newsitem.title: USA: Reuters to supply online news to Lycos.
newsitem.headline: Reuters to supply online news to Lycos.

text.p: Reuters NewMedia Inc said on Tuesday that it agreed to supply a wide range of news and picture services to Lycos Inc for display on the Lycosnavigation Center Web site.
The site -- at http://www.lycos.com -- generates some 6.5 million page views daily, the Reuters Holdings Plc subsidiary noted. Financial terms were not disclosed.
Lycos is a Web navigational center providing Internet users with a point of reference from which to start on the World Wide Web. Its majority shareholder is CMG Information Services Inc.

"Leading navigational centers such as Lycos generate the heaviest Web traffic," said Andrew Nibley, Executive Vice President, Reuters NewMedia. "Since the essential financial model for publishing on the Web is advertising-based, the fact that these sites attract such large and responsive audiences makes them attractive venues for Reuters news as well."
Reuters NewMedia said it will supply Lycos with:
-- The Reuters Online News Service, a package of top 10 news stories, updated throughout each day, in five subject categories -- US news, international news, business, sports and entertainment news.
-- The Reuters/Variety Online Entertainment Report, a real-time news service edited in Hollywood covering national and international aspects of the entertainment industry.
-- The Reuters News Pictures Service, a daily feed of news pictures from US and international datelines featuring general, sports and entertainment coverage.
--The Reuters Technology Report, a service providing approximately 10 stories each day covering news, trends, company profiles and executive interviews from the high technology industries.
-- The Reuters Oddly Enough Report, a daily collection of 15-to-20 short, humorous and quirky stories from around the world, edited to appeal to a general audience.
-- Reuters Health eLine, a service providing about 10 daily consumer-oriented stories dealing with health issues.
-- States News by States News Service, daily summaries of top local and regional news from 44 states, provided by States News Service of Washington, DC and distributed by Reuters.
